fields.value: Roll Call Votes from the Câmara de Deputados

dsDescriptionValue.value: This study contains all roll calls votes taken in the lower house of the Brazilian legislature (Câmara de Deputados), between 1989 and 2010. It combines data originally collected by Figueiredo & Limongi with data publicly available from the Câmara de Deputados' website. These data were used in the paper Distinguishing Between Influences on Brazilian Legislative Behavior. Estimates of legislator's positions presented in the paper are available in a related study. Data will be updated when possible.

publicationCitation.value: Zucco, Cesar and Lauderdale, Benjamin (2011). Distinguishing Between Influences on Brazilian Legislative Behavior. Legislative Studies Quarterly, 36(3), p.363–396

value: Ideal point estimates generated using these data are available here.

files.description: This file includes meta-data for MOST roll calls taken in and after 1995. It was compiled from data available in the website of the Camara de Deputados. The information on the bill being voted on can be matched to the roll call vote data by the identifier of the roll call (i.e. one can match the  column names in the roll call data files to the field "rcvoteid" in this file.)
files.label: billsdescription_rcvotes1995-2009.tab

dataFile.description: This file includes meta-data for MOST roll calls taken in and after 1995. It was compiled from data available in the website of the Camara de Deputados. The information on the bill being voted on can be matched to the roll call vote data by the identifier of the roll call (i.e. one can match the  column names in the roll call data files to the field "rcvoteid" in this file.)

files.description: Variables include a legislator's name, state, party, a "bioID" code that identifies the legislator in the Camara's website, and "incab", which indicates the share of roll calls in the set in which the party was in the government's coalition (defined as holding a cabinet seat). The remaining columns are the roll call identifiers, in which 1=Yea, 0=Nay, and NA is abstention or did not vote. If a legislator switched parties, he/she will show up more than once in the dataset.
files.label: rcdata19891990simple.csv
